==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|眉|尖|刀}}

===Etymology===
See {{ja-l|薙刀}}. The {{lang|ja|眉尖刀}} spelling (“eyebrow pointy blade”) is [[ateji]], based on the shape of the ''naginata'' blade vaguely resembling an eyebrow turned up at the end.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|なぎなた}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=なぎなた|薙刀|dot=:}} {{lb|ja|sort=なぎなた|weaponry}} a traditional Japanese [[halberd]]: a [[polearm]] historically used to cut down [[infantry]] and [[cavalry]]
